channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. troops and equipment will leave Niger by mid-September, the Pentagon says
item.description: Niger's decision to kick out American forces dealt a blow to U.S. military operations in the Sahel. U.S. troops and some gear already have begun leaving the country.
item.content:encoded: Niger's decision to kick out American forces dealt a blow to U.S. military operations in the Sahel. U.S. troops and some gear already have begun leaving the country.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Sean Combs apologizes for 'my actions in that video' that appeared to show an assault
item.description: Without addressing his then-girlfriend Cassie Ventura, who is seen in the video being kicked and dragged in 2016, the hip-hop mogul says, "I was disgusted then when I did it. I'm disgusted now."
item.content:encoded:
Without addressing his then-girlfriend Cassie Ventura, who is seen in the video being kicked and dragged in 2016, the hip-hop mogul says, "I was disgusted then when I did it. I'm disgusted now."

(Image credit: Willy Sanjuan)
item.dc:creator: John Helton

item.title: At age 90, America's first Black astronaut candidate has finally made it to space
item.description: Ed Dwight, a former Air Force test pilot who was passed over to become an astronaut in the 1960s, described his flight aboard Blue Origin's New Shepard as "life changing."
item.content:encoded: Ed Dwight, a former Air Force test pilot who was passed over to become an astronaut in the 1960s, described his flight aboard Blue Origin's New Shepard as "life changing."
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: At Morehouse, Biden says dissent should be heard because democracy is 'still the way'
item.description: Facing potential headwinds with both young voters and Black voters, President Biden's Morehouse College commencement address focused on his view of the importance - and future of - democracy.
item.content:encoded:
Facing potential headwinds with both young voters and Black voters, President Biden's Morehouse College commencement address focused on his view of the importance - and future of - democracy.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: In Knesset speech, GOP's Elise Stefanik calls for unrestricted U.S. war aid to Israel
item.description: Stefanik spoke before a caucus of Israel's parliament focused on antisemitism on college campuses around the world. She called for Hamas to be wiped "off the face of the earth."
item.content:encoded: Stefanik spoke before a caucus of Israel's parliament focused on antisemitism on college campuses around the world. She called for Hamas to be wiped "off the face of the earth."
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Rescuers are searching for the helicopter that was carrying the president of Iran
item.description: The state-run IRNA media outlet reported that the aircraft carrying President Ebrahim Raisi and other senior officials went down as the president returned from an event on the border with Azerbaijan.
item.content:encoded: The state-run IRNA media outlet reported that the aircraft carrying President Ebrahim Raisi and other senior officials went down as the president returned from an event on the border with Azerbaijan.
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: 'There is no respect anymore' as ambulances come under attack in South Africa
item.description: That's what one paramedic says of the targeting of ambulance crews. Criminals are after phones and wallets along with medical equipment and drugs. We ride along with a Cape Town crew in a Red Zone.
item.content:encoded: That's what one paramedic says of the targeting of ambulance crews. Criminals are after phones and wallets along with medical equipment and drugs. We ride along with a Cape Town crew in a Red Zone.
item.dc:creator: Tommy Trenchard

item.title: An airstrike kills 20 in central Gaza as Israel's leaders air wartime divisions
item.description: An Israeli airstrike killed 20 people in central Gaza, mostly women and children, on Sunday, as fighting raged and Israel's leaders aired divisions over who should govern Gaza after the war.
item.content:encoded: An Israeli airstrike killed 20 people in central Gaza, mostly women and children, on Sunday, as fighting raged and Israel's leaders aired divisions over who should govern Gaza after the war.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The jawbone of washed-up whale in New Zealand was removed with chainsaw and stolen
item.description: The jawbone of a nearly 50-foot sperm whale that washed ashore in New Zealand's southernmost region has been removed. While the act is illegal, it's also considered disrespectful to the Māori people.
item.content:encoded: The jawbone of a nearly 50-foot sperm whale that washed ashore in New Zealand's southernmost region has been removed. While the act is illegal, it's also considered disrespectful to the Māori people.
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: U.S. national security adviser and Saudi Arabia crown prince hold security deal talks
item.description: President Biden's national security adviser met early Sunday with Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to discuss a wide-ranging security agreement between the countries.
item.content:encoded: President Biden's national security adviser met early Sunday with Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to discuss a wide-ranging security agreement between the countries.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
